intro: Uragoga carpinterensis, commonly known as the Caribbeana fern, is a species of fern native to the Caribbean region. It belongs to the family Blechnaceae and is characterized by its intricate fronds with a distinctive, serrated edge. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as along stream banks and in forest understories. Its rhizomes are fibrous and help anchor it to rocky substrates, while its spores are dispersed by wind. The botanical features of Uragoga carpinterensis make it an important component of tropical ecosystems.
